alert.note: Alert for Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:58PM CDT until March 31 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR ROCK ISLAND...SCOTT...NORTHEASTERN MUSCATINE AND SOUTH CENTRAL CLINTON COUNTIES... At 558 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over West Lake Park, or near Davenport, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Eldridge, Long Grove, Riverdale, Panorama Park, Davenport Municipal Airport, Rock Island Arsenal, Bettendorf, Park View, Scott County Park, Pleasant Valley, Le Claire, Port Byron, Princeton, McCausland, Cordova, Rock Creek Marina and Campground, Rock Creek Park, Folletts, Princeton Wildlife Area and Malone. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
